conclusion: Need to analyze the process depicted in the P-V diagram of the Stirling cycle.
State A: Initial state of the gas.
State B: Gas at a higher pressure and volume.
State C: Gas at a lower pressure and volume.
State D: Gas at a lower pressure and volume.
The process A→B is isothermal, meaning the temperature remains constant.
The process C→D is also isothermal, meaning the temperature remains constant.
State B is at a higher pressure and volume compared to state A.
State C is at a lower pressure and volume compared to state A.
The thermal motion of gas molecules is directly related to the pressure and volume of the gas.
In state B, the gas is at a higher pressure and volume, which means the molecules are moving faster and have more kinetic energy.
In state C, the gas is at a lower pressure and volume, which means the molecules are moving slower and have less kinetic energy.
The thermal motion of gas molecules becomes more intense when transitioning from state B to state C.
